reasoning: Croup (acute laryngotracheobronchitis) incidence estimated at ~1500 per 100k person-years globally, with much higher rates in children under 5 (~3000-4000 per 100k). Peak incidence in fall/winter months. Using incidence as this is an acute viral respiratory illness with clear episode onsets. Based on epidemiological surveys from multiple developed countries.
source: Bjornson CL et al. (2004). Croup. Lancet. 363(9427):1877-1888
